Package com.example.marill_many_events.models

Class EventViewModel

java.lang.Object
androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
com.example.marill_many_events.models.EventViewModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventsCallback
public class EventViewModel extends androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel implements EventsCallback
ViewModel class for managing event-related data and operations. Provides LiveData for observing user-related event lists and handles event interactions such as registration, deletion, and status updates.

    • getUserOwnedList

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<List<Event>> getUserOwnedList()

    • leaveList

      public void leaveList(Event event)
      Removes the specified event from the appropriate list based on its current status. If the event is in the user's pending list, it is rejected. If the event is in the user's waitlist, the user leaves the waitlist. If the event is in the user's active events, the user leaves the event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to be removed from the user's list.

    • getUserEventlist

      public void getUserEventlist()
      Fetches all events that the user is currently registered for and updates the LiveData. Clears the current list of user events and repopulates it by retrieving references to the user's events from Firestore.

    • getUserWaitlist

      public void getUserWaitlist()
      Fetch all events the user is registered in and update LiveData.

    • getUserPendinglist

      public void getUserPendinglist()
      Fetch all events the user is registered in and update LiveData.

    • getUserOwnedEvents

      public void getUserOwnedEvents()
      Fetches all events owned by the user and updates the LiveData. Retrieves the facility document using the user's ID and extracts the list of event IDs from the "events" field. For each event ID, it fetches the event details and populates the user's owned events list.

    • fetchEventDetails

      public void fetchEventDetails(String eventId)
      Fetches the details of a specific event by its ID. Retrieves the event document from the "events" collection using the provided event ID and adds it to the user's owned events list.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to fetch.

    • setSelectedEvent

      public void setSelectedEvent(Event event)
      Sets the currently selected event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to be set as selected.

    • registerUser

      public void registerUser()
      Register a user to an event by atomically adding user to event's waitlist and event to user's events

    • registerUserGeo

      public void registerUserGeo(com.google.firebase.firestore.GeoPoint geoPoint)
      Register a user to an event by atomically adding user to event's waitlist and event to user's events, accounting for their geolocation

    • enterUser

      public void enterUser()
      Adds the current user as an entrant to the selected event. Removes the event from the user's "pending" list and adds it to their "events" list. Simultaneously updates the event's "pending" list and adds the user to its "entrants" list. This operation is performed atomically using a Firestore batch operation.

    • leaveEvent

      Leave an event as a user

      Parameters:

      public com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference getUserReference()
      Retrieves the DocumentReference for the current user.
      Returns:
      The DocumentReference for the user's Firestore document.

    • setUserReference

      Sets the DocumentReference for the current user.
      Parameters:

    • userOwnsEvent

      public boolean userOwnsEvent()
      Checks whether the current user owns the currently selected event.
      Returns:
      true if the user owns the event; false otherwise.

    • performDraw

      public void performDraw()
      Performs a random draw to select entrants for the currently selected event. Removes unselected entrants from the waitlist and sends notifications.
